item.title: Report X-2023081090
item.description:
Report X-2023081090

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When package was being unloaded from the trailer, it was wet so package was sent to QA for inspection by management. When inspected, two bottles inside package was found with loose caps causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

item.title: Report E-2023090147
item.description:
Report E-2023090147

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 25, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of isopropanol alcohol (UN1219) was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged container of product were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 15-gallon drum to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023090121
item.description:
Report E-2023090121

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 25, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of bioside was damaged and released approximately its full contents to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon to remediate the impacted site. Ancon personnel deployed granular absorbents, absorbent pads, and utilized a pressure washer to the bioside-impacted roadway, trailer interior/exterior and freight. All spent absorbents, absorbent pads and damaged drum were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums and one (1) 95-gallon over-pack for terminal disposal.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one case of epoxy (un1263) had been crushed by other freight and that one of the inner metal on gallon can had released 1 cup of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023090083
item.description:
Report E-2023090083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An employee was offloading a trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Richmond, CA and was staging the drums outside of the trailer prior to receiving the drums to the designated location. He was utilizing a forklift in which he was approaching 4 drums that were palletized. The employee did not realize that the pallet was not a standard size pallet and was not as deep. The forks exceeded the length of the pallet and hit the drum that was on the opposing side. The forks hit the drum roughly an inch above the bottom chime resulting in the drum getting damaged and a small pinhole leak occurred. The overall duration of the incident was a less than 10 minutes and it was determined that approximately 4 to 5 cups of material leaked out. The Veolia employees on site were able to contain the spill and place the damaged drum into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2023090078
item.description:
Report E-2023090078

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, three (3) 5-gallon pails of UN2014 combusted during transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. PES personnel observed the hydrogen peroxide has evaporated. PES personnel over packed the three (3) 5-gallon pails into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All UN2014-impacted waste was staged onsite for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080966
item.description:
Report E-2023080966

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UAD experienced a UN1823 Caustic Soda Micropearls release from (18) 50-pound paper bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 24-ounces of product released impacting a 4 x 4 area of the trailer and dock floors due to multiple bag punctures. All damaged bags were removed from the two pallets and all released product, along with cleanup debris and PPE were collected into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The remaining bags were placed on pallets, re-stacked and secured for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080943

  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET AND TORN. NO MARKINGS USED INDICATING SHIPPING STATUS OF GOODS. DAMAGED DURING OVERHEAD SORTATION. DescribePack: BOTH BOTTLES LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAPS AND BROKEN SEALS. SIX OUNCES OF MATERIALS LOSS. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023080848
item.description:
Report X-2023080848

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The shipment exterior packaging was wet on the top side and the box was removed from the sort stream and placed into a plastic lined container. DescribePack: One of the bottles of the shipment had a loose unsealed cap ; seepage had collected near the join to the rest of the body. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up with neutral absorbent material. The rest of the items in the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container for inspection and processing.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Managers called in for a spill. Upon arriving I noticed it was a hazmat and I equipped the proper PPE. I used absorbent to mitigate the spill, placed the package in a hazardous material bag and tote and brought to QA for processing. DescribePack: Bottle cap failed to seal, causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I placed absorbent mats to mitigate the leakage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded from trailer and started leaking when placed on the rollers. QA was called and came right away. Package and any spilled liquid was bagged, binned, and taken to the processing cage. DescribePack: One of the four gallons inside has a loose lid and is 75% empty. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was called right away, package handlers were removed from the area, and package was taken to the hazmat processing cage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 26th a package containing UN1760, Corrosive Liquid, n.o.s. (trimethylopropane triglcidylether), 8, III. The package had a small leak and it is unknown how the package developed the leak. The spill was cleaned and the package was placed into a salvage drum. an amended shippers declaration has been requested.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of release at the ONTR facility. While investigating the fiberboard box the spill agent discovered that one of the plastic bottles inside had spilled its contents inside of the fiberboard box. The bottles were packaged with bubble wrap. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.
